intro: Scaligeria microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited scaligeria, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs.
